Class Coordinate

  • java.lang.Object
    • Coordinate
  • public class Coordinate
extends Object
    A simple way to manage x,y pairs with precision. Now with built in (optional) angle variable. All values are stored as double, but can be set or retrieved as int or double. (Graphics2D's Point2D class is similar, but not supported on the Greenfoot Gallery)
    Version:
    November 2021
    Author:
    Jordan Cohen

      • getPreciseRotation

        public double getPreciseRotation()
        Retrieve the precise angle, in degrees
        Returns:
        double the precise angle, in degrees

      • getRotation

        public int getRotation()
        Retrieve the angle, rounded to the nearest int. Note that this does not round the internal angle variable, only the returned value.
        Returns:
        int the angle, in degrees

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Retrieve the rounded x coordinate. Note that this does not round the internal angle variable, only the returned value.
        Returns:
        int the x coordinate, rounded to a whole number

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Retrieve the rounded x coordinate. Note that this does not round the internal angle variable, only the returned value.
        Returns:
        int the x coordinate, rounded to a whole number

      • toString

        public String toString()
        toString method. Returns a String containing all three internal variables. This can be useful for troubleshooting, and is not intended to be callled by live code.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        String a string representation with x, y and angle
